## Recommended (additional) reading

**What are different ways one can approach a modelling problem?**

Checkout the upcoming book ['Modeling Mindsets'](https://book.modeling-mindsets.com/) [@molnar_modeling_2022, chapters 2-3] (it's free to read online) to learn about the traditional frequentist statistics vs Bayesian statistics vs Machine Learning approaches.

## Digital Skills Lab

[Digital Skills Lab](https://info.lse.ac.uk/current-students/digital-skills-lab) offer R and python workshops during Term time, and they will also give DSI students access to self-paced programming courses on Dataquest.

If you want to take the self-paced course to revise basic R programming, sign up via [this link](https://lse.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_6DbHqit2R8Y324u).

Keep an eye on the following pages for news of the in-person workshops:
- R: https://info.lse.ac.uk/current-students/digital-skills-lab/r
- Python: https://info.lse.ac.uk/current-students/digital-skills-lab/python
